page.title: 11SEWAGE PART 2
page.content: {SECONDARY TREATMENT.}BIOLOGICAL FILTERATION. The biological treatment is where sewage is passed through a circular or triangular tank which contains rocks and stones.Mother nature takes control of this process. The plant allows fresh air to circulate and small flies to feed on the sewage. This cleans some of the sewage. Bacteria covers the rocks and feed. {TERTIARY TREATMENT.}At Charlton the flow of sewage is then passed through large fields of grass to remove any remaining solids. If the sewage plant is large enough then the flow of the water should be in a clear liquid sparkling form. This is then discharged into rivers were it is used for pond life and wildlife. Finally it finds it way back into the water system.
